microstructure: one face-centered cubic (FCC) and two BCC phases
evidence: The results show that the phase structure of CrHfNbTaTi changes from the single body-centered cubic (BCC) phase of HfNbTaTiZr alloy to multiple phases, composed of one face-centered cubic (FCC) and two BCC phases. Additionally, the yield strength of the alloy significantly increases from 926 MPa to 1258 MPa and 1366 MPa in the as-cast and as-homogenized state, respectively, while promising ductility of $ 24.3% elongation is retained in the as-cast state.

microstructure: Typical dendritic structure with average primary arm size of 2 lm
evidence: The yield strength, r 0:2 , is 1258 AE 15 MPa for the as-cast CrHfNbTaTi specimen but increases slightly to 1366 AE 15 MPa after homogenized annealing, being almost 1.5 times that (926 MPa) of HfNbTaTiZr. After yielding, the as-cast CrHfNbTaTi alloy showed an obviously continuous strengthening stage until the occurrence of fracture at the maximum value of 2061 MPa, while the ashomogenized alloy reached just 1775 MPa before fracture. Meanwhile, it is also worth noting that the ultimate strain of the studied alloy decreased greatly from 24.3% in the as-cast state to 12.9% in the

microstructure: FCC phase corresponds to the interdendritic regions with the Cr-containing Laves phase structure
evidence: After replacement of Zr by Cr, the phase structure of a new CrHfNbTaTi HEA changed from the single BCC phase of HfNbTaTiZr alloy to multiple phases, composed of one FCC phase and two BCC phases. The yield strength increased from 926 MPa to 1258 and 1366 MPa ascast and as-homogenized CrHfNbTaTi, while a superior ultimate strain of 24.3% was retained for the as-cast alloy.
